document.docTitle: Plebs sachalinensis Joseph & Framenau 2012, COMB. NOV.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematic review of a new orb-weaving spider genus (Araneae: Araneidae), with special reference to the Australasian-Pacific and South-East Asian fauna

Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types: Holotype of
Argiope sachalinensis Saito, 1934
. ♀ from Sakhalin Oblast ( Russia ), Sakhalin . Lost ( Tanikawa, 2000 ). Not examined. Holotype female of
Araneus tokachianus Saito, 1934
. ♀ from Hokkaido Prefecture ( Japan ), Mount Tokachidake. Lost ( Tanikawa, 2000 ). Not examined. Holotype female of
Zilla flavomaculata Yaginuma, 1955
. ♀ from Mie Prefecture ( Japan ) (Arachnological Society of Japan ) ( Tanikawa, 2000 ). Not examined. Holotype of
Araneus pineus Yin, Wang, Xie & Peng, 1990
. ♀ from Hunan Province ( China ), Chengbu County, Nan Mountain, 28.vii.1982 , Jiafu Wang & Yongjing Zhang (HNU). Not examined. Paratypes of
Araneus pineus Yin, Wang, Xie & Peng, 1990
. Nine ♀♀ , data as holotype . Not examined. Holotype male of
Eriophora flava Zhu & Zong, 1994
. ♂ from Hainan Province ( China ), Mount Jianfengling, 12.xii.1989 , Mingsheng Zhu (MHBU). Not examined.
Material examined: Three males and nine females from nine records (Appendix S1).

Remarks: This widespread and well-recognized species was originally described in the genus
Argiope ( Saito, 1934 )
, but has since undergone a number of reviews and revisions resulting in multiple synonyms and generic transfers (see list of synonyms above). In his revision of western Pacific Argiopinae, Levi (1983: 262) noted that this species is ‘probably an
Araneus
’. We have examined specimens from Japan and China , and based on their agreement with our generic concept of
Plebs
and the position in our phylogenetic analysis ( Fig. 3 ), we here propose the generic transfer
Plebs sachalinensis ( Saito, 1934 )
comb. nov.
